Class GameWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • GameWorld
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The GameWorld class is the top-level game class which contains everything needed to properly run a complete game. It can be serialized or deserialized for saving and loading purposes.
    Version:
    0.1 Skeleton code only
    Author:
    Steven Bertolucci
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GameWorld()
      Creates a new GameWorld with save location at the given path.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String displayCurrentRoom()
      Read the room that the player is currently in and parse it into a single, displayable String.
      boolean isLoss()
      Get the loss state of the game at the current moment.
      boolean isWon()
      Get the win state of the game at the current moment.
      void parseAndUpdate(java.lang.String command)
      Parse the input into a keyword and an argument.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameWorld

        public GameWorld()
        Creates a new GameWorld with save location at the given path. Everything else about initial GameWorlds should be identical.

    • Method Detail

      • parseAndUpdate

        public void parseAndUpdate(java.lang.String command)
                    throws InvalidSyntaxException
        Parse the input into a keyword and an argument. Then, update the current GameWorld object to reflect the result of the command.
        Parameters:
        command - the String to be parsed
        Throws:
        InvalidSyntaxException - thrown if a command cannot be parsed

      • isWon

        public boolean isWon()
        Get the win state of the game at the current moment.
        Returns:
        true if the game has reached a win condition

      • isLoss

        public boolean isLoss()
        Get the loss state of the game at the current moment.
        Returns:
        true if the game has reached a loss condition

      • displayCurrentRoom

        public java.lang.String displayCurrentRoom()
        Read the room that the player is currently in and parse it into a single, displayable String.
        Returns:
        the String representation of the player's current room
